Another valuable government agency which can
help resolve certain other kinds of problems is
the IRAC ( Interdependent Radio Advisory Com¬
mittee) . This is an inter-agency structure
created to facilitate the resolution of problems
which cut across agency responsibilities, and
affected more than one agency. It is the IRAC
which can be of decisive help in those cases
where government-owned and operated facilities
are involved, or required (as with REA or FCC).
The FCC, therefore, may be of help in resolving
some of the engineering problems related to the
feasibility of using REA capability. Their par¬
ticipation (FCC), and REA cooperation, could be
achieved through the intervention of the IRAC,
since it is an intermediary group to which both
agencies belong.
We envision utilization of the services of the
IRAC to resolve the problems of developing Com¬
munications For Survival systems in rural areas.
